label: 夏花
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Gebana (J.) 夏花, sometimes pronounced natsubana. Practice, particularly prominent among aristocrats and in the palace, of offering flowers to the Buddha at the beginning of the season of clerical retreat (夏安居 ge-ango).
